abstract: Big gains in equity investments buoyed Bank of America’s earnings in the fourth quarter.
snippet: Big gains in equity investments buoyed Bank of America’s earnings in the fourth quarter.
lead_paragraph: Big gains in equity investments buoyed Bank of America’s earnings in the fourth quarter, which were up 47 percent from the same period in 2005, the bank reported today.

abstract: Bank of America and Wachovia, two of the nation’s largest banks, said Tuesday that their profits rose sharply in the fourth quarter compared with the same period a year earlier. Results at both banks were helped by major acquisitions in 2006. Bank of America, which bought the credit-card giant MBNA last year, said its net income rose 47 percent, to $5.26 billion, in the fourth quarter. Wachovia, which picked up Golden West Financial, said its fourth-quarter profit increased 35 percent, to $2.3 billion.
